result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D. Schaefer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Comply with any and all counseling or treatment as recommended by the Agent
*No contact with the victim except with Agent approval
*Bond to be applied
*Credit to be determined by counsel -to be used if revoked
**12-12-2017 amended to include 75 days of sentence credit 
*If probation is discharged/revoked with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due and/or other collection procedures will be implemented. If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmate monies to pay fines/costs/surcharges/restitution with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Robert D. Schaefer in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Johnson agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

  State has complied with victim notification requirements and files a victim impact statement with the defendant and the court. Court takes a moment to review.  Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
No contact with the victim accept for Agent allowance
bond to be applied
Credit to be determined by counsel and only to be used if ever revoked.
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

  If probation is discharged/revoked with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due and/or other collection procedures will be implemented. If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmate monies to pay fines/costs/surcharges/restitution with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 2, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Jury trial on September 28, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on September 1, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Final pre-trial on August 4, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on September 14, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Final pre-trial on June 2, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on July 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert D. Schaefer in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Johnson asks that the matter be set on the trial calendar.

BY THE COURT:  Set for trial
bond continued  Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Return date on April 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert D. Schaefer in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the parties have had discussions on resolution however, the parties are not resolved yet.
Atty Johnson believes that resolution is still possible and asks for another return.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Return date on February 15, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Robert D. Schaefer in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Johnson; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Johnson agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Johnson states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.   Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

12-7-16 cash bond amended from $1500 to $500
with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*No contact with the victim dob 9-17-03
Preliminary hearing on January 4, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert D. Schaefer in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there has been discussion with possible settlement. Today, Atty Johnson would like to argue bail and then have a Prelim be reset.  Court notes that time limits have been waived.  Atty Johnson was appointed on the case and did not realize that he was in custody; asks for a signature bond to be set.  Atty Johnson requests the Prelim be set out.
Atty Hendee responds and asks that the cash bail remain the same.  Atty Johnson asks for a reduction of bail if a signature bond is not set.

BY THE COURT: Bond to be reduced to a $500 cash bond with same conditions.
Reset Preliminary Hearing  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.   Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.

Court questions the defendant regarding time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived for the Prelim.  Set Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Robert D. Schaefer in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court confirms the defendant's address.

Atty Hendee requests a $1,500 cash bond with conditions.

*No contact with victim dob 9-17-03  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
